alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Magoffin; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:10PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Martin, southeastern Johnson, northern Floyd, northwestern Pike and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 209 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Davisport to near Bays Branch to Sublett. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Davisport, Bays Branch, Auxier, East Point, Oaklawn Estates, Nero, Van Lear, Odds and Meally around 215 PM EDT. Prestonsburg, Cliff, Davella, Delong, Pevier and Debord around 220 PM EDT. Dock around 225 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Lancer, Pleasant, Preece, Bradbury, Prince, Corn Fork Hollow, Dicks Creek, Martin, Allen, Alvin, Emma, Moree, McClure, Dwale, Endicott, Allen City and Beaver Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
